page.title: 02ST.MARY'S CHURCH BROOK.
page.content: The village church in{BROOK,}is dedicated to St Mary.The original church was built on the site by the landowner,before the Norman Conquest. The only remains of this original church is the north aisle,due to a fire.The church was then rebuilt, but in 1863 a further fire destroyed it again. The church was then rebuilt for a second time in the thirteenth century lancet style using the original archway.A tower was added later along with a shingled spire. The church shows examples of thirteenth century sculpture,an Early English door and silver plate.
